description: This chapter discusses Paul's rights as an apostle and how he used those rights. Paul explains the sacrifices he made for spreading the gospel, the methods he used to reach different kinds of people, and the importance of self-discipline in the Christian life.

questions.question: What questions does Paul ask about himself in verse 1?
What does Paul say about seeing Jesus our Lord?
options: Have I not seen Jesus our Lord?
I have never seen Jesus our Lord
I have heard about Jesus our Lord
I have read about Jesus our Lord

questions.question: What does Paul call the Corinthians in relation to his work?
options: The result of my work in the Lord

questions.question: What are the Corinthians to Paul's apostleship in the Lord?
What right does Paul claim to have regarding food and drink?
What did the other apostles do according to verse 5?
options: They took a believing wife along with them
They walked from town to town

questions.question: Who does Paul mention as possibly lacking the right not to work for a living?
Who plants a vineyard and does not eat what?
What is written in the Law of Moses according to verse 9?
options: Do not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain

questions.question: According to verse 10, whoever plows should plow in what?
What did Paul sow among the Corinthians?
Why did Paul not use his rights according to verse 12?
options: Rather than hinder the gospel of Christ
Because of what others might think

questions.question: Those who serve in the temple get their food from where?
What has the Lord commanded about those who preach the gospel?
options: They should receive their living from their work
They should receive their living from the church
They should receive their living from donations
They should receive their living from the gospel

questions.question: What would Paul rather do than allow anyone to deprive him of his boast?
What can Paul not do when he preaches the gospel?
How does Paul describe his obligation to preach the gospel?
If Paul preaches voluntarily, what does he have?
What does Paul say is his reward?
options: Offering the gospel free of charge

questions.question: Though free and belonging to no one, what has Paul made himself to win as many as possible?
To win the Jews, what did Paul become?
Though not free from God's law, under what law does Paul say he is?
What has Paul become to all people to save some?
Why does Paul do all these things?
options: For the sake of the gospel, that he may share in its blessings

questions.question: In a race all the runners run, but how many get the prize?
Everyone who competes in the games goes into what kind of training?
What kind of crown do those who compete in games receive?
options: A crown that will not last

questions.question: What kind of crown do believers compete for?
options: A crown that will last forever

questions.question: How does Paul say he does NOT run?
What does Paul do to his body according to verse 27?
options: Strikes a blow to it and makes it his slave
